articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer greeted President Volodymyr Zelenskiy with a warm embrace on Saturday after the Ukrainian leader flew to London for talks following his clash at the White House with U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy gets warm welcome in UK after Trump clash

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will try to revive hope for peace in Ukraine at a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskiy and other Western leaders on Sunday, two days after the Ukrainian leader and U.S. President Donald Trump clashed in Washington.
articles.title: UK's Starmer tries to revive hope for Ukraine peace at summit

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Timour Azhari
articles.description: For years, soldiers from Russia's Hmeimim Air Base in Syria roamed freely through coastal cities. War planes flew from the complex to bombard Islamist rebels fighting Bashar al-Assad's repressive regime.
articles.title: Insight: Russia gambles to keep military bases in post-Assad Syria

articles.author: Emily Rose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Jaidaa Ahmad
articles.description: Israel said it will adopt the proposal for Ramadan and Passover.
articles.title: Israel blocks aid into Gaza as ceasefire standoff escalates

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian shelling overnight killed one person and injured two more in the eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk and Russian forces attacked Ukraine with 79 drones, Ukraine's authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russian attacks overnight kill one, injure three in Ukraine, officials say

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday ordered a new trade investigation that could heap more tariffs on imported lumber, adding to existing duties on Canadian softwood lumber and 25% tariffs on all Canadian and Mexican goods due next week.
articles.title: Trump orders new tariff probe into US lumber imports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO member Norway will continue to supply fuel for U.S. Navy ships, the country's defence minister said on Sunday, after a call from a private marine fuel supplier to stop doing so in response to the apparent breakdown in U.S.-Ukrainian relations.
articles.title: Norway says it will keep supplying fuel to US navy after company calls for boycott

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis is in a stable condition as he fights double pneumonia in hospital for the 17th day, and is resting having had a peaceful night, the Vatican said on Sunday.
articles.title: Pope Francis stable in hospital, had peaceful night, Vatican says

articles.author: Ivana Sekularac
articles.description: Thousands stood in silence for 15 minutes in the southern city of Nis on Saturday to commemorate those killed in a railway station disaster, in a student-led protest that has grown into the biggest threat yet to the Serbian president's grip on power.
articles.title: Serbians hold silent protest to honour railway station victims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran’s parliament impeached Economy Minister Abdolnaser Hemmati on Sunday, state media reported, almost eight months after President Masoud Pezeshkian’s cabinet was formed.
articles.title: Iran's parliament impeaches economy minister, state media says
